result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin Lee R.J. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court sentences Mr. Miller to 18 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 12 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 6 months. This sentence is to commence concurrent to Jefferson County Case 13CF81.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses uncharged referrals DA Case#16JE22 (Retail Theft on 11/28/15 at Watertown Walmart) and DA Case#16JE414 (Retail Theft on 10/4/15 at Watertown Kwik Trip) and bars them from further prosecution
Concurrent with: Jefferson County Case 13CF81

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay restitution of $130.96 payable to Pick n Save, Watertown

--To pay 10% restitution surcharge

--To pay restitution of $378.76 payable to Walmart-16JE22

--To pay 10% restitution surcharge-16JE22
--To pay costs and fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge
--Make legitimate and honest efforts to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent

--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
 
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores

--No possession or consumption of alcohol

--No possession of any needles/syringes or the like unless medically necessary per treating physician

--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as approved per Agent

--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
 
--Random drug/alcohol screening
 
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed

--  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: WATERTOWN PD

--Court presents basis and denies expungement
--To undergo any type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:31 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Dustin Lee R.J. Miller in court, in-custody, with Attorney Matthew Edward Weil. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck submits victim impact statement for uncharged read-in 16JE22

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses uncharged referrals DA Case#16JE22 (Retail Theft on 11/28/15 at Watertown Walmart) and DA Case#16JE414 (Retail Theft on 10/4/15 at Watertown Kwik Trip) and bars them from further prosecution

Court sentences Mr. Miller to 18 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 12 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 6 months. This sentence is to commence concurrent to Jefferson County Case 13CF81.
Court finds that the Defendant has been properly charged as/convicted as repeater

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 52 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To undergo any type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random drug/alcohol screening
--Make legitimate and honest efforts to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
--No possession of any needles/syringes or the like unless medically necessary per treating physician
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as approved per Agent
--To pay restitution of $130.96 payable to Pick n Save, Watertown
--To pay 10% restitution surcharge
--To pay costs and fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge
--To pay restitution of $378.76 payable to Walmart-16JE22
--To pay 10% restitution surcharge-16JE22

Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Court presents basis and denies expungement
Recess: 2:03 pm
Status conference on June 13, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.

case called at 9:44am. 
Defendant Dustin Lee R.J. Miller in court, in custody, with Attorney Matthew Edward Weil.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant
The Court continues the bond requirement. 
recess 9:48am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/25/16 at 11:00am,    (2)  Status Conference on 6/13/16 at 1:15pm
Adjourned initial appearance on May 6, 2016 at 09:30 am. (5/4/16 date given out in Court was incorrect.  Correct date is 5/6/16)
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 9:41am. 
Defendant Dustin Lee R.J. Miller in court, in custody.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given. The Court directs and orders that the Public Defender is to meet with Mr. Miller in the Jefferson County Jail regarding application for PD eligibility.
The Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 

The Court requires $850 Cash Bond, with conditions: 
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Terence Janke or with Jason Twaite 
--no presence at the Pick 'N  Save in Watertown 
recess 9:45am 


NEXT:  (1) clerk- please notify the PD Office that they are to meet with Mr. Miller in the Jail for an eligibility determination (2) Adjourned Initial Appearance on 5/4/16 at 9:30am.
